intro: Vernonanthura chaquensis, commonly known as the Chaquense Vernonanthura, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers, which bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
